alert.note: Alert for Spokane (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 21 at 5:27PM PST until February 21 at 6:30PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Spokane County in northeastern Washington... * Until 630 PM PST. * At 525 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 14 miles northeast of Davenport to near Liberty Lake, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 270 and 299. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 267 and 297. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington between mile markers 85 and 95. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 165 and 169. Locations impacted include... Spokane, Spokane Valley, Liberty Lake, Airway Heights, Medical Lake, Nine Mile Falls, Millwood, Otis Orchards-East Farms, Fairwood, Fairchild AFB, Otis Orchards, Green Acres, Trentwood, Country Homes, Town And Country, Dishman, Mead, Rockford, Valleyford and Opportunity. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
